 25#define VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE 0

 28#  include <vsip_csl/output/domain.hpp>

 35namespace par_chain_assign
 36{
 37
 38template <typename OrderT,
 39	  typename ExtDataT>
 40inline void
 41chain_add(
 42  impl::Chain_builder& builder,
 43  ExtDataT&            ext,
 44  Domain<1> const&     dom)
 45{
 46  typedef typename ExtDataT::element_type element_type;
 47
 48  dimension_type const dim0 = OrderT::impl_dim0;
 49  assert(dim0 == 0);
 50
 51  builder.add<element_type>(sizeof(element_type) * dom.first()*ext.stride(dim0),
 52			  dom.stride() * ext.stride(dim0),
 53			  dom.length());
 54}
 55
 56
 57
 58template <typename OrderT,
 59	  typename ExtDataT>
 60inline void
 61chain_add(
 62  impl::Chain_builder& builder,
 63  ExtDataT&            ext,
 64  Domain<2> const&     dom)
 65{
 66  typedef typename ExtDataT::element_type element_type;
 67
 68  dimension_type const dim0 = OrderT::impl_dim0;
 69  dimension_type const dim1 = OrderT::impl_dim1;
 70
 71  builder.add<element_type>(
 72              sizeof(element_type) * (dom[dim0].first()*ext.stride(dim0) +
 73				      dom[dim1].first()*ext.stride(dim1)),
 74	      dom[dim0].stride() * ext.stride(dim0), dom[dim0].length(),
 75	      dom[dim1].stride() * ext.stride(dim1), dom[dim1].length());
 76}
 77
 78
 79
 80template <typename OrderT,
 81	  typename ExtDataT>
 82inline void
 83chain_add(
 84  impl::Chain_builder& builder,
 85  ExtDataT&            ext,
 86  Domain<3> const&    dom)
 87{
 88  typedef typename ExtDataT::element_type element_type;
 89
 90  dimension_type const dim0 = OrderT::impl_dim0;
 91  dimension_type const dim1 = OrderT::impl_dim1;
 92  dimension_type const dim2 = OrderT::impl_dim2;
 93
 94  for (index_type i = 0; i < dom[dim0].size(); ++i)
 95  {
 96    builder.add<element_type>(
 97                sizeof(element_type) *
 98		  ( (dom[dim0].first()+i*dom[dim0].stride())*ext.stride(dim0)
 99		  +  dom[dim1].first()                      *ext.stride(dim1)
100		  +  dom[dim2].first()                      *ext.stride(dim2)),
101		dom[dim1].stride() * ext.stride(dim1), dom[dim1].length(),
102		dom[dim2].stride() * ext.stride(dim2), dom[dim2].length());
103  }
104}
105
106
107
108
109template <dimension_type Dim,
110	  typename       T,
111	  typename       Block,
112	  typename       AppMapT,
113	  typename       ExtDataT>
114void
115build_ext_array(
116  typename View_of_dim<Dim, T, Block>::const_type view,
117  AppMapT&                                      am,
118  ExtDataT**                                    array,
119  sync_action_type                              sync)
120{
121  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::type local_block_type;
122  typedef typename View_of_dim<Dim, T, local_block_type>::const_type
123		local_view_type;
124
125  processor_type rank = local_processor();
126
127  // First set all subblock ext pointers to NULL.
128  length_type tot_sb = am.num_subblocks();
129  for (index_type sb=0; sb<tot_sb; ++sb)
130    array[sb] = NULL;
131
132  // Then, initialize the subblocks this processor actually owns.
133  index_type sb = am.subblock(rank);
134  if (sb != no_subblock)
135  {
136    local_view_type local_view = get_local_view(view);
137    array[sb] = new ExtDataT(local_view.block(), sync);
138  }
139}
140
141
142
143template <typename ExtDataT>
144void
145cleanup_ext_array(
146  length_type num_subblocks,
147  ExtDataT**  array)
148{
149  for (index_type sb=0; sb<num_subblocks; ++sb)
150    if (array[sb] != NULL)
151      delete array[sb];
152}
153
154} // namespace par_chain_assign
155
156
157// Chained parallel assignment.
158template <dimension_type Dim,
159	  typename       T1,
160	  typename       T2,
161	  typename       Block1,
162	  typename       Block2>
163class Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>
164  : Compile_time_assert<Is_split_block<Block1>::value ==
165                        Is_split_block<Block2>::value>
166{
167  static dimension_type const dim = Dim;
168
169  // disable_copy should only be set to true for testing purposes.  It
170  // disables direct copy of data when source and destination are on
171  // the same processor, causing chains to be built on both sides.
172  // This is helps cover chain-to-chain copies for par-services-none.
173  static bool const disable_copy = false;
174
175  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block1>::type dst_local_block;
176  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block2>::type src_local_block;
177
178  typedef typename View_of_dim<dim, T1, dst_local_block>::type
179		dst_lview_type;
180
181  typedef typename View_of_dim<dim, T2, src_local_block>::const_type
182		src_lview_type;
183
184  typedef impl::Persistent_ext_data<src_local_block> src_ext_type;
185  typedef impl::Persistent_ext_data<dst_local_block> dst_ext_type;
186
187  typedef typename Block1::map_type dst_appmap_t;
188  typedef typename Block2::map_type src_appmap_t;
189
190  typedef typename Block_layout<Block1>::order_type dst_order_t;
191
192  typedef impl::Communicator::request_type request_type;
193  typedef impl::Communicator::chain_type   chain_type;
194
195  /// A Msg_record holds a piece of a data transfer that together
196  /// describe a complete communication.
197  ///
198  /// Members:
199  ///   PROC_ is the remote processor (to send to or receive from),
200  ///   SUBBLOCK_ is the local subblock to,
201  ///   DATA_ is the raw data pointer of the local subblock,
202  ///   CHAIN_ is the DMA chain representing the data from subblock_
203  ///      to send.
204  ///
205  /// Notes:
206  ///   [1] CHAIN_ completely describes the data to send/receive,
207  ///       but it is dependent on the distributed blocks storage
208  ///       location remaining unchanged from when the list is built
209  ///       to when it is executed.  SUBBLOCK_ and DATA_ are stored
210  ///       to check consistentcy and potentially update CHAIN_ if
211  ///       the storage location changes.
212
213  struct Msg_record
214  {
215    Msg_record(processor_type proc, index_type sb, chain_type chain)
216      : proc_    (proc),
217        subblock_(sb),
218	chain_   (chain)
219      {}
220
221  public:
222    processor_type proc_;    // destination processor
223    index_type     subblock_;
224    chain_type     chain_;
225  };
226
227
228
229  /// A Copy_record holds part of a data transfer where the source
230  /// and destination processors are the same.
231  ///
232  /// Members:
233  ///   SRC_SB_ is the source local subblock,
234  ///   DST_SB_ is the destination local subblock,
235  ///   SRC_DOM_ is the local domain within the source subblock to transfer,
236  ///   DST_DOM_ is the local domain within the destination subblock to
237  ///      transfer.
238
239  struct Copy_record
240  {
241    Copy_record(index_type src_sb, index_type dst_sb,
242	       Domain<Dim> src_dom,
243	       Domain<Dim> dst_dom)
244      : src_sb_  (src_sb),
245        dst_sb_  (dst_sb),
246	src_dom_ (src_dom),
247	dst_dom_ (dst_dom)
248      {}
249
250  public:
251    index_type     src_sb_;    // destination processor
252    index_type     dst_sb_;
253    Domain<Dim>    src_dom_;
254    Domain<Dim>    dst_dom_;
255  };
256
257
258  // Constructor.
259public:
260  Par_assign(
261    typename View_of_dim<Dim, T1, Block1>::type       dst,
262    typename View_of_dim<Dim, T2, Block2>::const_type src)
263    : dst_      (dst),
264      src_      (src.block()),
265      dst_am_   (dst_.block().map()),
266      src_am_   (src_.block().map()),
267      comm_     (dst_am_.impl_comm()),
268      send_list (),
269      recv_list (),
270      copy_list (),
271      req_list  (),
272      msg_count (0),
273      src_ext_ (new src_ext_type*[src_.block().map().num_subblocks()]),
274      dst_ext_ (new dst_ext_type*[dst_.block().map().num_subblocks()])
275  {
276    profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-cons");
277    assert(src_am_.impl_comm() == dst_am_.impl_comm());
278
279    par_chain_assign::build_ext_array<Dim, T2, Block2>(
280      src_, src_am_, src_ext_, impl::SYNC_IN);
281    par_chain_assign::build_ext_array<Dim, T1, Block1>(
282      dst_, dst_am_, dst_ext_, impl::SYNC_OUT);
283
284    build_send_list();
285    if (!disable_copy)
286      build_copy_list();
287    build_recv_list();
288  }
289
290  ~Par_assign()
291  {
292    // At destruction, the list of outstanding sends should be empty.
293    // This would be non-empty if:
294    //  - Par_assign did not to clear the lists after
295    //    processing it (library design error), or
296    //  - User executed send() without a corresponding wait().
297    assert(req_list.size() == 0);
298
299    if (send_list.size() > 0)
300    {
301      typedef typename std::vector<Msg_record>::iterator sl_iterator;
302      sl_iterator sl_cur = send_list.begin();
303      sl_iterator sl_end = send_list.end();
304      for (; sl_cur != sl_end; ++sl_cur)
305      {
306	impl::free_chain((*sl_cur).chain_);
307      }
308    }
309
310    if (recv_list.size() > 0)
311    {
312      typedef typename std::vector<Msg_record>::iterator rl_iterator;
313      rl_iterator rl_cur = recv_list.begin();
314      rl_iterator rl_end = recv_list.end();
315      for (; rl_cur != rl_end; ++rl_cur)
316      {
317	impl::free_chain((*rl_cur).chain_);
318      }
319    }
320
321    par_chain_assign::cleanup_ext_array(dst_am_.num_subblocks(), dst_ext_);
322    par_chain_assign::cleanup_ext_array(src_am_.num_subblocks(), src_ext_);
323
324    delete[] dst_ext_;
325    delete[] src_ext_;
326  }
327
328
329  // Implementation functions.
330private:
331
332  void build_send_list();
333  void build_recv_list();
334  void build_copy_list();
335
336  void exec_send_list();
337  void exec_recv_list();
338  void exec_copy_list();
339
340  void wait_send_list();
341
342  void cleanup() {}	// Cleanup send_list buffers.
343
344
345  // Invoke the parallel assignment
346public:
347  void operator()()
348  {
349    if (send_list.size() > 0) exec_send_list();
350    if (copy_list.size() > 0) exec_copy_list();
351    if (recv_list.size() > 0) exec_recv_list();
352
353    if (req_list.size() > 0)  wait_send_list();
354
355    cleanup();
356  }
357
358
359  // Private member data.
360private:
361  typename View_of_dim<Dim, T1, Block1>::type       dst_;
362  typename View_of_dim<Dim, T2, Block2>::const_type src_;
363
364  dst_appmap_t const& dst_am_;
365  src_appmap_t const& src_am_;
366  impl::Communicator& comm_;
367
368  std::vector<Msg_record>    send_list;
369  std::vector<Msg_record>    recv_list;
370  std::vector<Copy_record>   copy_list;
371
372  std::vector<request_type> req_list;
373
374  int                       msg_count;
375
376  src_ext_type**            src_ext_;
377  dst_ext_type**            dst_ext_;
378};
379
380
381
382/***********************************************************************
383  Definitions
384***********************************************************************/
385
386// Build the send_list, a list of processor-subblock-local_domain
387// records.  This can be done in advance of the actual assignment.
388
389template <dimension_type Dim,
390	  typename       T1,
391	  typename       T2,
392	  typename       Block1,
393	  typename       Block2>
394void
395Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::build_send_list()
396{
397  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-build_send_list");
398  processor_type rank = local_processor();
399
400#if VSIPL_IMPL_PCA_ROTATE
401  index_type  offset = src_am_.impl_rank_from_proc(rank);
402#endif
403  length_type dsize  = dst_am_.impl_working_size();
404  // std::min(dst_am_.num_subblocks(), dst_am_.impl_pvec().size());
405
406#if VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
407    std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
408	      << "build_send_list(dsize: " << dsize
409	      << ") -------------------------------------\n";
410#endif
411
412  index_type src_sb = src_am_.subblock(rank);
413
414  // If multiple processors have the subblock, the first processor
415  // is responsible for sending it.
416
417  if (src_sb != no_subblock &&
418      *(src_am_.processor_begin(src_sb)) == rank)
419  {
420    // Iterate over all processors
421    for (index_type pi=0; pi<dsize; ++pi)
422    {
423      // Rotate message order so processors don't all send to 0, then 1, etc
424      // (Currently does not work, it needs to take into account the
425      // number of subblocks).
426#if VSIPL_IMPL_PCA_ROTATE
427      processor_type proc = dst_am_.impl_proc_from_rank((pi + offset) % dsize);
428#else
429      processor_type proc = dst_am_.impl_proc_from_rank(pi);
430#endif
431
432      // Transfers that stay on this processor is handled by the copy_list.
433      if (!disable_copy && proc == rank)
434	continue;
435
436      index_type dst_sb = dst_am_.subblock(proc);
437
438      if (dst_sb != no_subblock)
439      {
440	// Check to see if destination processor already has block
441	if (!disable_copy && processor_has_block(src_am_, proc, src_sb))
442	  continue;
443
444	impl::Chain_builder builder;
445	src_ext_type* ext = src_ext_[src_sb];
446	ext->begin();
447
448	for (index_type dp=0; dp<num_patches(dst_, dst_sb); ++dp)
449	{
450	  Domain<dim> dst_dom = global_domain(dst_, dst_sb, dp);
451
452	  for (index_type sp=0; sp<num_patches(src_, src_sb); ++sp)
453	  {
454	    Domain<dim> src_dom  = global_domain(src_, src_sb, sp);
455	    Domain<dim> src_ldom = local_domain(src_, src_sb, sp);
456
457	    Domain<dim> intr;
458
459	    if (intersect(src_dom, dst_dom, intr))
460	    {
461	      Domain<dim> send_dom = apply_intr(src_ldom, src_dom, intr);
462
463	      par_chain_assign::chain_add<dst_order_t>(builder, *ext, send_dom);
464
465#if VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE >= 2
466	      std::cout << "(" << rank << ") send "
467			<< rank << "/" << src_sb << "/" << sp
468			<< " -> "
469			<< proc << "/" << dst_sb << "/" << dp
470			<< " src: " << src_dom
471			<< " dst: " << dst_dom
472			<< " intr: " << intr
473			<< " send: " << send_dom
474		// << " val: " << get(local_view, first(send_dom))
475			<< std::endl;
476#endif
477	    }
478	  }
479	}
480	if (!builder.is_empty())
481	  send_list.push_back(Msg_record(proc, src_sb, builder.get_chain()));
482	ext->end();
483      }
484    }
485  }
486}
487
488
489
490// Build the recv_list, a list of processor-subblock-local_domain
491// records.  This can be done in advance of the actual assignment.
492
493template <dimension_type Dim,
494	  typename       T1,
495	  typename       T2,
496	  typename       Block1,
497	  typename       Block2>
498void
499Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::build_recv_list()
500{
501  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-build_recv_list");
502  processor_type rank = local_processor();
503
504#if VSIPL_IMPL_PCA_ROTATE
505  index_type  offset = dst_am_.impl_rank_from_proc(rank);
506#endif
507  length_type ssize  = src_am_.impl_working_size();
508
509#if VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
510    std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
511	      << "build_recv_list(ssize: " << ssize
512	      << ") -------------------------------------\n";
513#endif
514
515  index_type dst_sb = dst_am_.subblock(rank);
516
517  if (dst_sb != no_subblock)
518  {
519    dst_ext_type* ext = dst_ext_[dst_sb];
520    ext->begin();
521      
522    // Iterate over all sending processors
523    for (index_type pi=0; pi<ssize; ++pi)
524    {
525      // Rotate message order so processors don't all send to 0,
526      // then 1, etc (Currently does not work, it needs to take into
527      // account the number of subblocks).
528      // processor_type proc = (src_am_.impl_proc_from_rank(pi) + rank) % size;
529      processor_type proc = src_am_.impl_proc_from_rank(pi);
530
531      // Transfers that stay on this processor is handled by the copy_list.
532      if (!disable_copy && proc == rank)
533	continue;
534      
535      impl::Chain_builder builder;
536      
537      index_type src_sb = src_am_.subblock(proc);
538
539      // If multiple processors have the subblock, the first processor
540      // is responsible for sending it to us.
541
542      if (src_sb != no_subblock &&
543	  *(src_am_.processor_begin(src_sb)) == proc)
544      {
545	// Check to see if destination processor already has block
546	if (!disable_copy && processor_has_block(src_am_, rank, src_sb))
547	  continue;
548
549	for (index_type dp=0; dp<num_patches(dst_, dst_sb); ++dp)
550	{
551	  Domain<dim> dst_dom  = global_domain(dst_, dst_sb, dp);
552	  Domain<dim> dst_ldom = local_domain(dst_, dst_sb, dp);
553	  
554	  for (index_type sp=0; sp<num_patches(src_, src_sb); ++sp)
555	  {
556	    Domain<dim> src_dom = global_domain(src_, src_sb, sp);
557	    
558	    Domain<dim> intr;
559	    
560	    if (intersect(dst_dom, src_dom, intr))
561	    {
562	      Domain<dim> recv_dom = apply_intr(dst_ldom, dst_dom, intr);
563	      
564	      par_chain_assign::chain_add<dst_order_t>(builder, *ext, recv_dom);
565	      
566#if VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
567	      std::cout << "(" << rank << ") recv "
568			<< rank << "/" << dst_sb << "/" << dp
569			<< " <- "
570			<< proc << "/" << src_sb << "/" << sp
571			<< " dst: " << dst_dom
572			<< " src: " << src_dom
573			<< " intr: " << intr
574			<< " recv: " << recv_dom
575		// << " val: " << get(local_view, first(recv_dom))
576			<< std::endl;
577#endif
578	    }
579	  }
580	}
581      }
582      if (!builder.is_empty())
583	recv_list.push_back(Msg_record(proc, dst_sb, builder.get_chain()));
584    }
585    ext->end();
586  }
587}
588
589
590
591template <dimension_type Dim,
592	  typename       T1,
593	  typename       T2,
594	  typename       Block1,
595	  typename       Block2>
596void
597Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::build_copy_list()
598{
599  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-build_copy_list");
600  processor_type rank = local_processor();
601
602#if VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
603  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
604	    << "build_copy_list(num_procs: " << src_am_.num_processors()
605	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
606#endif
607
608  index_type dst_sb = dst_am_.subblock(rank);
609  if (dst_sb != no_subblock)
610  {
611
612    index_type src_sb = src_am_.subblock(rank);
613    if (src_sb != no_subblock)
614    {
615      for (index_type dp=0; dp<num_patches(dst_, dst_sb); ++dp)
616      {
617	Domain<dim> dst_dom  = global_domain(dst_, dst_sb, dp);
618	Domain<dim> dst_ldom = local_domain (dst_, dst_sb, dp);
619
620	for (index_type sp=0; sp<num_patches(src_, src_sb); ++sp)
621	{
622	  Domain<dim> src_dom  = global_domain(src_, src_sb, sp);
623	  Domain<dim> src_ldom = local_domain (src_, src_sb, sp);
624
625	  Domain<dim> intr;
626
627#if VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE >= 2
628//	  std::cout << " - dst " << dst_sb << "/" << dp << std::endl
629//		    << "   src " << src_sb     << "/" << sp << std::endl
630//	    ;
631#endif
632
633	  if (intersect(src_dom, dst_dom, intr))
634	  {
635	    Domain<dim> send_dom = apply_intr(src_ldom, src_dom, intr);
636	    Domain<dim> recv_dom = apply_intr(dst_ldom, dst_dom, intr);
637
638	    copy_list.push_back(Copy_record(src_sb, dst_sb,
639					    send_dom, recv_dom));
640
641#if VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE >= 2
642	    std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
643		      << "copy src: " << src_sb << "/" << sp
644		      << " " << send_dom
645		      << "  dst: " << dst_sb << "/" << dp
646		      << " " << recv_dom
647		      << std::endl
648		      << "    "
649		      << "src_dom: " << src_dom
650		      << "  src_ldom: " << src_ldom
651		      << std::endl
652		      << "    "
653		      << "dst_dom: " << dst_dom
654		      << "  dst_ldom: " << dst_ldom
655		      << std::endl
656		      << "  intr: " << intr
657		      << std::endl
658	      ;
659#endif
660	  }
661	}
662      }
663    }
664  }
665}
666
667
668
669// Execute the send_list.
670
671template <dimension_type Dim,
672	  typename       T1,
673	  typename       T2,
674	  typename       Block1,
675	  typename       Block2>
676void
677Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::exec_send_list()
678{
679  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-exec_send_list");
680
681#if VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
682  processor_type rank = local_processor();
683  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
684	    << "exec_send_list(size: " << send_list.size()
685	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
686#endif
687  typedef typename std::vector<Msg_record>::iterator sl_iterator;
688
689  {
690    sl_iterator sl_cur = send_list.begin();
691    sl_iterator sl_end = send_list.end();
692    for (; sl_cur != sl_end; ++sl_cur)
693    {
694      impl::Chain_builder builder;
695      processor_type proc = (*sl_cur).proc_;
696
697      src_ext_type* ext = src_ext_[(*sl_cur).subblock_];
698      ext->begin();
699      builder.stitch(ext->data(), (*sl_cur).chain_);
700      ext->end();
701      
702      chain_type chain = builder.get_chain();
703      request_type   req;
704      comm_.send(proc, chain, req);
705      impl::free_chain(chain);
706      req_list.push_back(req);
707    }
708  }
709}
710
711
712
713// Execute the recv_list.
714
715template <dimension_type Dim,
716	  typename       T1,
717	  typename       T2,
718	  typename       Block1,
719	  typename       Block2>
720void
721Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::exec_recv_list()
722{
723  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-exec_recv_list");
724
725#if VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
726  processor_type rank = local_processor();
727  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
728	    << "exec_recv_list(size: " << recv_list.size()
729	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
730#endif
731
732  typedef typename std::vector<Msg_record>::iterator rl_iterator;
733  rl_iterator rl_cur = recv_list.begin();
734  rl_iterator rl_end = recv_list.end();
735    
736  for (; rl_cur != rl_end; ++rl_cur)
737  {
738    impl::Chain_builder builder;
739    processor_type proc = (*rl_cur).proc_;
740
741    dst_ext_type* ext = dst_ext_[(*rl_cur).subblock_];
742    ext->begin();
743    builder.stitch(ext->data(), (*rl_cur).chain_);
744    ext->end();
745
746    chain_type chain = builder.get_chain();
747    comm_.recv(proc, chain);
748    impl::free_chain(chain);
749  }
750}
751
752
753
754// Execute the copy_list.
755
756template <dimension_type Dim,
757	  typename       T1,
758	  typename       T2,
759	  typename       Block1,
760	  typename       Block2>
761void
762Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::exec_copy_list()
763{
764  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-exec_copy_list");
765
766#if VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
767  processor_type rank = local_processor();
768  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
769	    << "exec_copy_list(size: " << copy_list.size()
770	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
771#endif
772
773  src_lview_type src_lview = get_local_view(src_);
774  dst_lview_type dst_lview = get_local_view(dst_);
775
776  typedef typename std::vector<Copy_record>::iterator cl_iterator;
777  for (cl_iterator cl_cur = copy_list.begin();
778       cl_cur != copy_list.end();
779       ++cl_cur)
780  {
781    view_assert_local(src_, (*cl_cur).src_sb_);
782    view_assert_local(dst_, (*cl_cur).dst_sb_);
783
784    dst_lview((*cl_cur).dst_dom_) = src_lview((*cl_cur).src_dom_);
785#if VSIP_IMPL_PCA_VERBOSE >= 2
786    std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
787	      << "src subblock: " << (*cl_cur).src_sb_ << " -> "
788	      << "dst subblock: " << (*cl_cur).dst_sb_ << std::endl
789	      << dst_lview((*cl_cur).dst_dom_);
790
791    // std::cout << "  from: " << (*cl_cur).src_dom_ << std::endl;
792    // std::cout << "  to  : " << (*cl_cur).dst_dom_ << std::endl;
793#endif
794  }
795}
796
797
798
799// Wait for the send_list instructions to be completed.
800
801template <dimension_type Dim,
802	  typename       T1,
803	  typename       T2,
804	  typename       Block1,
805	  typename       Block2>
806void
807Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::wait_send_list()
808{
809  typename std::vector<request_type>::iterator
810		cur = req_list.begin(),
811		end = req_list.end();
812  for(; cur != end; ++cur)
813  {
814    comm_.wait(*cur);
815  }
816  req_list.clear();
817}
818

823} // namespace vsip
